channel.title: Age in Seconds! Version 1.2 released! FINAL!
channel.description:
Okay, I made this script for fun because I was curious of my age in seconds. This is version 1.0, it doesn't count leap years yet, [s]I'll include that in the next version because I don't know how to divide in Pascal, I use DIV but I get an "Identifier expected" error. Well, here's the script[/s] :P Fixed :P
[scar]{.Script Info: # ScriptName = Age In Seconds # Author = Zeh Progage # Description = This tells your age in seconds in years, meaning if you're 14 years old it'd count 14 years worth of seconds. # Version = 1.0 # Date = December 13, 2006 # Comments = This is a pretty simple script with a couple variables, nothing more. /Script Info} program Age; var s: Integer; var age: Integer; begin age := 14; //Change to your age in years. Default is 14 because that's how old I am lol. s := 0; s := 60 * 60 * 24 * 365 * age writeln('You are ' + inttostr(s) + ' seconds old!') end.[/scar]
[b]EDIT:[/b] Version 1.1 with leap year in it :) Next script will have booleans that you can alter, and then I will worry about forms for this thing lol. Just a baby step at a time ;) I'll try to finish version 1.2 tomorrow. ;D [scar]{.Script Info: # ScriptName = Age In Seconds # Author = Zeh Progage # Description = This tells your age in seconds in years, meaning if you're 14 years old it'd count 14 years worth of seconds. # Version = 1.1 # Date = December , 2006 # Comments = Added "Leap Years" into the equation. Next version will include whether or not you want to do leap years. Maybe in version 1.3 I'll add forms. /Script Info} program Age; var s,age,xtra,xq,q: Integer; begin age := 14; //Change to your age in years. s := 60 * 60 * 24 * 365 * age xtra := age DIV 4 xq := xtra * 86400 q := s + xq If (age >= 4) Then Writeln('You are ' + inttostr(q) + ' seconds old counting leap year(s)!'); end.[/scar] [b]EDIT:[/b] Version 1.2 :) I won't be able to do forms, it seems it isn't really worth it right now. I may try this again and use forms, but until then I'll try to make more using SCAR :) [scar]{.Script Info: # ScriptName = Age In Seconds # Author = Zeh Progage # Description = This tells your age in seconds in years, meaning if you're 14 years old it'd count 14 years worth of seconds. # Version = 1.2 # Date = December 13, 2006 # Comments = Now you can choose whether to use leap years or not. /Script Info} program Age; var s,age,xtra,xq,q: Integer; var bleap: Boolean; begin age := 14; //Change to your age in years. s := 60 * 60 * 24 * 365 * age xtra := age DIV 4 xq := xtra * 86400 q := s + xq bleap := false; // If this is true, it'll do leap years. If false, it'll tell your age in seconds without leap years. If (age >= 4) and (bleap = true) Then writeln('You are ' + inttostr(q) + ' seconds old counting leap year(s)!') else writeln('You are ' + inttostr(s) + ' seconds old, not counting leap years!'); end.[/scar]

item.title: Age in Seconds! Version 1.2 released! FINAL!

Hotkeys are the only way to copy or paste something in the Scar window, with the exception of the copy/paste button. You can’t right click in Scar.

item.source: Age in Seconds! Version 1.2 released! FINAL!

item.title: Age in Seconds! Version 1.2 released! FINAL!
item.dc:creator: @junkj junkj
item.description:
@junkj wrote:

dave5534:

I cant copy and past it.

Here ya go, this will copy and paste trust me!

[code]{.Script Info:

ScriptName = Age In Seconds

Author = Zeh Progage

Description = This tells your age in seconds in years, meaning if you’re 14 years old it’d count 14 years worth of seconds.

Version = 1.2

Date = December 13, 2006

Comments = Now you can choose whether to use leap years or not.

/Script Info}
program Age;
var s,age,xtra,xq,q: Integer;
var bleap: Boolean;
begin
age := 14; //Change to your age in years.
s := 60 * 60 * 24 * 365 * age
xtra := age DIV 4
xq := xtra * 86400
q := s + xq
bleap := false; // If this is true, it’ll do leap years. If false, it’ll tell your age in seconds without leap years.
If (age >= 4) and (bleap = true) Then
writeln(‘You are ’ + inttostr(q) + ’ seconds old counting leap year(s)!’)
else
writeln(‘You are ’ + inttostr(s) + ’ seconds old, not counting leap years!’);
end.
[/code]

Weibs:

Use the hotkeys, ctrl+c to copy, ctrl+v to paste.

Hot keys wont work either ;D

Read full topic

item.title: Age in Seconds! Version 1.2 released! FINAL!
item.dc:creator: @HISTORY HISTORY
item.description:
@HISTORY wrote:

[quote=“Zeh Progage, post:18, topic:34917”][quote author=HISTORY link=topic=50129.msg623822#msg623822 date=1166190633]

nice formula^^ still trying to understand all the numbers and weird variable names lol
turned 14 today so its pretty accurate^^ 441763200 seconds old

but i think leap years would work well unless you the user had to input the year and see if he was born X years away from the leap year…
Ill see if i can add a more accurate thing:P with date of when you were born:P

Nice sig
I think the formula’s ok, since this is a trivial script. I may update sometime, but not for awhile, as I need to finish the PHP coding and the flash layout of my website. ;D
Oh and happy birthday
[/quote] why thank you:P
ill just keep updating it myself:P

Good luck, hopefully you make it a success ;)[br][size=1]Posted at: December 15, 2006, 03:22:49 AM[/size][hr][quote author=HISTORY link=topic=50129.msg623792#msg623792 date=1166188680]
nice formula^^ still trying to understand all the numbers and weird variable names lol
turned 14 today so its pretty accurate^^ 441763200 seconds old

but i think leap years would work well unless you the user had to input the year and see if he was born X years away from the leap year…
Ill see if i can add a more accurate thing:P with date of when you were born:P

edit: ok managed to find out what everything does:P
[scar]{.Script Info:

ScriptName = Age In Seconds,Hours,Days,Months,Years

Author = Zeh Progage Modded by HISTORY Aka Evil Kukka

Description = This tells your age in seconds in years, meaning if you’re 14 years old it’d count 14 years worth of seconds.

Version = 1.3

Date = December 13, 2006

Comments = Now you can choose whether to use leap years or not.

/Script Info}
program Age;
var
totalsecswithoutleap : Integer;
totalminswithoutleap : Integer;
totalhourswithoutleap : integer;
totaldayswithoutleap : integer;
age : Integer;
totalsecswithleap : Integer;
totalminswithleap : Integer;
totalhourswithleap : integer;
totaldayswithleap : integer;

countleaps: Boolean;

begin
age := 14; //Change to your age in years.
countleaps := true;// If this is true, it’ll do leap years. If false, it’ll tell your age in seconds without leap years.

totalsecswithoutleap := 60 * 60 * 24 * 365 * age;
totalminswithoutleap := 60 * 24 * 365 * age;
totalhourswithoutleap := 24 * 365 * age;
totaldayswithoutleap := 365 * age;

totalsecswithleap := totalsecswithoutleap + ((age DIV 4) * 86400);
totalminswithleap := totalminswithoutleap + ((age DIV 4) * 1440);
totalhourswithleap := totalhourswithoutleap + ((age DIV 4) * 24);
totaldayswithleap := totaldayswithoutleap +((age DIV 4) * 1);//yeah yeah lots of unnecessary stuff:P
If (age >= 4) and (countleaps) Then
begin
writeln(‘You are ’ + IntToStr(age) + ’ years old!’);
writeln(‘You are ’ + IntToStr(age * 12)+ ’ months old!’);
writeln(‘You are ’ + IntToStr(totaldayswithleap) + ’ days old, counting leap years!(s)’)
writeln(‘You are ’ + IntToStr(totalhourswithleap) + ’ hours old, counting leap years!(s)’)
writeln(‘You are ’ + IntToStr(totalminswithleap) + ’ minutes old, counting leap years!(s)’)
writeln(‘You are ’ + inttostr(totalsecswithleap) + ’ seconds old, counting leap years!(s)’)
end else
begin
writeln(‘You are ’ + IntToStr(age) + ’ years old!’);
writeln(‘You are ’ + IntToStr(age * 12)+ ’ months old!’);
writeln(‘You are ’ + IntToStr(totaldayswithoutleap) + ’ days old, not counting leap years!’)
writeln(‘You are ’ + IntToStr(totalhourswithoutleap) + ’ hours old, not counting leap years!’)
writeln(‘You are ’ + IntToStr(totalminswithoutleap) + ’ minutes old, not counting leap years!’)
writeln(‘You are ’ + inttostr(totalsecswithoutleap) + ’ seconds old, not counting leap years!’);
end;
end.[/scar]
havent implemented the date thing yet:P will use arrays but im bored now:P

[/quote]
O.O AWESOME dude! You really made that into a work of art! ;D
Hopefully someday I can script like you :D[/quote]
All i did was add a few statements and writelns…just wait till i add some arrays and forms:P

Read full topic

Good luck, hopefully you make it a success ;)[br][size=1]Posted at: December 15, 2006, 03:22:49 AM[/size][hr][quote=“HISTORY, post:15, topic:34917”]nice formula^^ still trying to understand all the numbers and weird variable names lol
turned 14 today so its pretty accurate^^ 441763200 seconds old

but i think leap years would work well unless you the user had to input the year and see if he was born X years away from the leap year…
Ill see if i can add a more accurate thing:P with date of when you were born:P

edit: ok managed to find out what everything does:P
[scar]{.Script Info:

ScriptName = Age In Seconds,Hours,Days,Months,Years

Author = Zeh Progage Modded by HISTORY Aka Evil Kukka

Description = This tells your age in seconds in years, meaning if you’re 14 years old it’d count 14 years worth of seconds.

Version = 1.3

Date = December 13, 2006

Comments = Now you can choose whether to use leap years or not.

/Script Info}
program Age;
var
totalsecswithoutleap : Integer;
totalminswithoutleap : Integer;
totalhourswithoutleap : integer;
totaldayswithoutleap : integer;
age : Integer;
totalsecswithleap : Integer;
totalminswithleap : Integer;
totalhourswithleap : integer;
totaldayswithleap : integer;

countleaps: Boolean;

begin
age := 14; //Change to your age in years.
countleaps := true;// If this is true, it’ll do leap years. If false, it’ll tell your age in seconds without leap years.

totalsecswithoutleap := 60 * 60 * 24 * 365 * age;
totalminswithoutleap := 60 * 24 * 365 * age;
totalhourswithoutleap := 24 * 365 * age;
totaldayswithoutleap := 365 * age;

totalsecswithleap := totalsecswithoutleap + ((age DIV 4) * 86400);
totalminswithleap := totalminswithoutleap + ((age DIV 4) * 1440);
totalhourswithleap := totalhourswithoutleap + ((age DIV 4) * 24);
totaldayswithleap := totaldayswithoutleap +((age DIV 4) * 1);//yeah yeah lots of unnecessary stuff:P
If (age >= 4) and (countleaps) Then
begin
writeln(‘You are ’ + IntToStr(age) + ’ years old!’);
writeln(‘You are ’ + IntToStr(age * 12)+ ’ months old!’);
writeln(‘You are ’ + IntToStr(totaldayswithleap) + ’ days old, counting leap years!(s)’)
writeln(‘You are ’ + IntToStr(totalhourswithleap) + ’ hours old, counting leap years!(s)’)
writeln(‘You are ’ + IntToStr(totalminswithleap) + ’ minutes old, counting leap years!(s)’)
writeln(‘You are ’ + inttostr(totalsecswithleap) + ’ seconds old, counting leap years!(s)’)
end else
begin
writeln(‘You are ’ + IntToStr(age) + ’ years old!’);
writeln(‘You are ’ + IntToStr(age * 12)+ ’ months old!’);
writeln(‘You are ’ + IntToStr(totaldayswithoutleap) + ’ days old, not counting leap years!’)
writeln(‘You are ’ + IntToStr(totalhourswithoutleap) + ’ hours old, not counting leap years!’)
writeln(‘You are ’ + IntToStr(totalminswithoutleap) + ’ minutes old, not counting leap years!’)
writeln(‘You are ’ + inttostr(totalsecswithoutleap) + ’ seconds old, not counting leap years!’);
end;
end.[/scar]
havent implemented the date thing yet:P will use arrays but im bored now:P[/quote]
O.O AWESOME dude! You really made that into a work of art! ;D
Hopefully someday I can script like you

item.description:
@HISTORY wrote:

nice formula^^ still trying to understand all the numbers and weird variable names lol
turned 14 today so its pretty accurate^^ 441763200 seconds old

but i think leap years would work well unless you the user had to input the year and see if he was born X years away from the leap year…
Ill see if i can add a more accurate thing:P with date of when you were born:P

edit: ok managed to find out what everything does:P
[scar]{.Script Info:

ScriptName = Age In Seconds,Hours,Days,Months,Years

Author = Zeh Progage Modded by HISTORY Aka Evil Kukka

Description = This tells your age in seconds in years, meaning if you’re 14 years old it’d count 14 years worth of seconds.

Version = 1.3

Date = December 13, 2006

Comments = Now you can choose whether to use leap years or not.

/Script Info}
program Age;
var
totalsecswithoutleap : Integer;
totalminswithoutleap : Integer;
totalhourswithoutleap : integer;
totaldayswithoutleap : integer;
age : Integer;
totalsecswithleap : Integer;
totalminswithleap : Integer;
totalhourswithleap : integer;
totaldayswithleap : integer;

countleaps: Boolean;

begin
age := 14; //Change to your age in years.
countleaps := true;// If this is true, it’ll do leap years. If false, it’ll tell your age in seconds without leap years.

totalsecswithoutleap := 60 * 60 * 24 * 365 * age;
totalminswithoutleap := 60 * 24 * 365 * age;
totalhourswithoutleap := 24 * 365 * age;
totaldayswithoutleap := 365 * age;

totalsecswithleap := totalsecswithoutleap + ((age DIV 4) * 86400);
totalminswithleap := totalminswithoutleap + ((age DIV 4) * 1440);
totalhourswithleap := totalhourswithoutleap + ((age DIV 4) * 24);
totaldayswithleap := totaldayswithoutleap +((age DIV 4) * 1);//yeah yeah lots of unnecessary stuff:P
If (age >= 4) and (countleaps) Then
begin
writeln(‘You are ’ + IntToStr(age) + ’ years old!’);
writeln(‘You are ’ + IntToStr(age * 12)+ ’ months old!’);
writeln(‘You are ’ + IntToStr(totaldayswithleap) + ’ days old, counting leap years!(s)’)
writeln(‘You are ’ + IntToStr(totalhourswithleap) + ’ hours old, counting leap years!(s)’)
writeln(‘You are ’ + IntToStr(totalminswithleap) + ’ minutes old, counting leap years!(s)’)
writeln(‘You are ’ + inttostr(totalsecswithleap) + ’ seconds old, counting leap years!(s)’)
end else
begin
writeln(‘You are ’ + IntToStr(age) + ’ years old!’);
writeln(‘You are ’ + IntToStr(age * 12)+ ’ months old!’);
writeln(‘You are ’ + IntToStr(totaldayswithoutleap) + ’ days old, not counting leap years!’)
writeln(‘You are ’ + IntToStr(totalhourswithoutleap) + ’ hours old, not counting leap years!’)
writeln(‘You are ’ + IntToStr(totalminswithoutleap) + ’ minutes old, not counting leap years!’)
writeln(‘You are ’ + inttostr(totalsecswithoutleap) + ’ seconds old, not counting leap years!’);
end;
end.[/scar]
havent implemented the date thing yet:P will use arrays but im bored now:P

[code]program New;

xtra: Integer;
age: Integer;

item.title: Age in Seconds! Version 1.2 released! FINAL!
item.dc:creator: @Zeh_Progage Zeh Progage
item.description:
@Zeh_Progage wrote:

[quote=“Weibs, post:4, topic:34917”]Trust me, it works. SCAR’s syntax isn’t completely based on pascal, it’s also derived from delphi. Try this:

[code]program New;

var
num, num2, num3: Integer;

begin
num := 10;
num2 := 5;

num3 := num / num2;
WriteLn(IntToStr(num) + ’ / ’ + IntToStr(num2) + ’ = ’ + IntToStr(Round(num3)));
end.[/code]

And for boolean variables, just set them to True or False, no quotations around it, just the word.[/quote]
Weird, because / doesn’t work unless both numbers are variables, so variable1 / 4 doesn’t work, but if variable2 is 4 and you did variable1 / variable2 it works…
Just finish 1.2
Going to finish 1.3 soon

Read full topic
item.source: Age in Seconds! Version 1.2 released! FINAL!

item.title: Age in Seconds! Version 1.2 released! FINAL!
item.dc:creator: @Weibs Weibs
item.description:
@Weibs wrote:

Trust me, it works. SCAR’s syntax isn’t completely based on pascal, it’s also derived from delphi. Try this:

[code]program New;

var
num, num2, num3: Integer;

begin
num := 10;
num2 := 5;

num3 := num / num2;
WriteLn(IntToStr(num) + ’ / ’ + IntToStr(num2) + ’ = ’ + IntToStr(Round(num3)));
end.[/code]

And for boolean variables, just set them to True or False, no quotations around it, just the word.

Read full topic
item.source: Age in Seconds! Version 1.2 released! FINAL!

item.title: Age in Seconds! Version 1.2 released! FINAL!
item.dc:creator: @Zeh_Progage Zeh Progage
item.description:
@Zeh_Progage wrote:

Weibs:

To divide use this: /

That doesn’t work in Pascal, I read up a little about using math in Pascal on Google (lol) and it said it uses DIV instead of / like most other programming languages. I just finished the leap year script and it works now Just can’t get Boolean variables to work.
This is just a learning experience, so I’ll figure it out someday.

Read full topic

item.source: Age in Seconds! Version 1.2 released! FINAL!

item.title: Age in Seconds! Version 1.2 released! FINAL!
item.dc:creator: @Zeh_Progage Zeh Progage
item.description:
@Zeh_Progage wrote:

Okay, I made this script for fun because I was curious of my age in seconds. This is version 1.0, it doesn’t count leap years yet, I’ll include that in the next version because I don’t know how to divide in Pascal, I use DIV but I get an “Identifier expected” error. Well, here’s the script Fixed

[scar]{.Script Info:

ScriptName = Age In Seconds

Author = Zeh Progage

Description = This tells your age in seconds in years, meaning if you’re 14 years old it’d count 14 years worth of seconds.

Version = 1.0

Date = December 13, 2006

Comments = This is a pretty simple script with a couple variables, nothing more.

/Script Info}
program Age;
var s: Integer;
var age: Integer;
begin
age := 14; //Change to your age in years. Default is 14 because that’s how old I am lol.
s := 0;
s := 60 * 60 * 24 * 365 * age
writeln(‘You are ’ + inttostr(s) + ’ seconds old!’)
end.[/scar]

EDIT: Version 1.1 with leap year in it Next script will have booleans that you can alter, and then I will worry about forms for this thing lol. Just a baby step at a time I’ll try to finish version 1.2 tomorrow. ;D
[scar]{.Script Info:

ScriptName = Age In Seconds

Author = Zeh Progage

Description = This tells your age in seconds in years, meaning if you’re 14 years old it’d count 14 years worth of seconds.

Version = 1.1

Date = December , 2006

Comments = Added “Leap Years” into the equation. Next version will include whether or not you want to do leap years. Maybe in version 1.3 I’ll add forms.

/Script Info}
program Age;
var s,age,xtra,xq,q: Integer;
begin
age := 14; //Change to your age in years.
s := 60 * 60 * 24 * 365 * age
xtra := age DIV 4
xq := xtra * 86400
q := s + xq
If (age >= 4) Then
Writeln(‘You are ’ + inttostr(q) + ’ seconds old counting leap year(s)!’);
end.[/scar]
EDIT: Version 1.2 I won’t be able to do forms, it seems it isn’t really worth it right now. I may try this again and use forms, but until then I’ll try to make more using SCAR
[scar]{.Script Info:

ScriptName = Age In Seconds

Author = Zeh Progage

Description = This tells your age in seconds in years, meaning if you’re 14 years old it’d count 14 years worth of seconds.

Version = 1.2

Date = December 13, 2006

Comments = Now you can choose whether to use leap years or not.

/Script Info}
program Age;
var s,age,xtra,xq,q: Integer;
var bleap: Boolean;
begin
age := 14; //Change to your age in years.
s := 60 * 60 * 24 * 365 * age
xtra := age DIV 4
xq := xtra * 86400
q := s + xq
bleap := false; // If this is true, it’ll do leap years. If false, it’ll tell your age in seconds without leap years.
If (age >= 4) and (bleap = true) Then
writeln(‘You are ’ + inttostr(q) + ’ seconds old counting leap year(s)!’)
else
writeln(‘You are ’ + inttostr(s) + ’ seconds old, not counting leap years!’);
end.[/scar]
